snippet: Human Rights Watch said that it had found serious human rights abuses in the mass trials of Bangladeshi paramilitary border guards accused of participating in a 2009 mutiny.
abstract: Human Rights Watch reports that it has found serious abuses in the mass trials of Bangladeshi paramilitary border guards accused of participating in a 2009 mutiny, including the deaths of at least 47 suspects from maltreatment in detention; about 3,000 border guards are on trial in the mutiny, in which 74 people, including 57 military commanders, died.
lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch said that it had found serious human rights abuses in the mass trials of Bangladeshi paramilitary border guards accused of participating in a 2009 mutiny.

headline.main: Bangladesh: Rights Group Cites Abuses in Mass Trials of Guards
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh: Rights Group Cites Abuses in Mass Trials of Guards

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
